definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: A person elected by the board of directors chairman, the Plenipotentiary companies.
sentences.chinese: 由董事会选任一人为董事长，全权代表公司。

sentences.english: In witness whereof, the undersigned Plenipotentiaries, duly authorized, have signed the present Treaty.
sentences.chinese: 下列正式受权的全权代表签署本条约以资证明。

sentences.english: Ambassadors and plenipotentiaries bowed low as the Emperor and Empress entered.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝和皇后进来时，大全和全权代表们都鞠躬致意。

sentences.english: All shareholders are to be present in person or by proxy.
sentences.chinese: 全体股东均须到会，由本人或全权代表出席。

sentences.english: Each member country is represented by a delegate with plenipotentiary power.
sentences.chinese: 每个成员国派一名全权代表参加。

definition: Foreign Secretary/(UK) Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Qing Dynasty
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
